course_title: Topics in Literary History: Latinx Lit.,1900 to Present
class_notes:
(This course will only meet synchronously Thursdays from 9:40am to 10:55am. The other course content will be delivered asynchronously.)
(Course Topic: Literary Histories: Topic: Latinx Literature, 1900 to the Present)
(This class examines the aftermath of colonial and nineteenth century crises as they are represented in Latinx literary production after 1900. Special emphasis will be placed upon ongoing colonialisms that fomented mass Latinx migration to the U.S. via the Mexican Revolution, Operation Bootstrap, WWI, WWII, the Cuban Revolution, and U.S. backed wars in Central and Latin America. Providing students with a historical grounding in the literary production of Latinx populations, we will examine the formation of a canon by taking up the question of form - novel, short story, poetry, plays, performance art, visual culture, memoir, and social media).
course_description: Long historical surveys of national, regional, or ethnic traditions; or of genres or subgenres. Examples: History of African Literature, History of Latinx Literature, History of Science Fiction, History of the Sonnet, History of Southern U.S. Literature, History of Drama.
